summary: Ragnar Lodbrok was a famous Viking hero and king of Sweden and Denmark in ancient stories. He lived during the 9th century and was known for leading many attacks on the British Isles and the Carolingian Empire. People tell stories about him in Old Norse poetry, Icelandic sagas, and old chronicles. According to these tales, his father was King Sigurd Ring of Sweden. Ragnar's nickname, "Lodbrok," means "hairy-breeches."
title: Ragnar Lodbrok
